intro: Hemimeris montana, commonly known as the mountain hemimeris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes species like willowherbs and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Hemimeris montana is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season, blooming in early spring.
